meanings.definition: In a gloomy or dejected manner.
meanings.sent1: She walked mopily to her room after receiving bad news.
meanings.sent2: He stared mopily out the window on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: Despite her friends' attempts to cheer her up, she remained mopily quiet.
meanings.sent4: The clouds hung mopily in the sky, casting a shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The old house stood mopily at the end of the street, abandoned and forgotten.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of energy or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: The mopily student struggled to stay awake during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent2: She gave a mopily half-hearted smile when asked if she was okay.
meanings.sent3: The dog looked mopily at its untouched food bowl, uninterested in eating.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden drooped mopily, lacking the usual vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The mopily lit room felt dull and lifeless, devoid of any excitement.

meanings.definition: In a sluggish or lethargic way.
meanings.sent1: The cat moved mopily across the room, clearly tired from playing.
meanings.sent2: He spoke mopily, his words slurred from exhaustion.
meanings.sent3: The car engine started mopily, struggling to turn over.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed mopily through the valley, its pace slow and steady.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked mopily on the wall, each second feeling longer than the last.
